result.execSummary:
The defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Full time employment/school or a combination of both.
Obtain a GED.
No contact with Pick and Save.

Participate in the Fatherhood Initiative Program.
Participate in parenting classes.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam not in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Same conditions to apply.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court, on its' own motion, ordered bail modified.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save at 250 W Holt Ave., Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Elliot T Oshkeshequoam in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
